headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Dutch Hill. A HAUL OF CULPRITS. AGRICULTURAL. Examinations in Ward School No. 35. St. David's Benevolent Society. The Police. The Excise Ordinance Sigued. Judge Hoffman Ill. New Steamer. Rock Blasting. AMERICAN BAPTIST MISSIONARY UNION. Adjournment of the Covention. EVENING SESSION. THE POOLE MURDER. James Iriving as an Accessory before the Fact. SUPREME COURT--IN CHAMBERS. THE EASTERN WAR. Dr. Solger on the Causes and Relations of the War in Europe.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is a droll-looking hamlet, that at the foot of Forty-first and Forty-second-streets, near East River. The houses are little board or mud shanties, scattered around like the wigwams of an Indian village, with most perplexing paths winding among them.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. The Mexican Boundary--The New Regments..

docs.lead_paragraph: News has just been received from Mayor EMERY, who states that on the 31st of January he fixed a locality for the monument which is to mark the Eastern terminus of our Mexican boundary upon Rio Grande, and that on the 7th of February he should leave there to mark out the boundary line, after having given directions for the erection of the monument. headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; ARRIVAL OF THE CAHAWBA Death--Banishment. FROM HAVANA.
NEW-YORK CITY.; Chief Matsell and a Special Committee. City Mortality. Veal Depreciating. Two Suicides. Sudden Death. COURT CALENDAR--MONDAY.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Special Committee of the Board of Aldermen recently appointed to make official inquiries of the Chief of Police in regard to a resolution which he refused to answer, were in session at the City Hall on Saturday. The Committee consists of Messrs BRIGGS, C. HI. TUCKER and HOFFMIRE. They were delayed for a long time in consequence of Chief MATSELL not appearing as directed. d.

headline.main: AMERICAN BAPTIST MISSIONARY UNION.; Special Meeting of the Board of Managers.

docs.lead_paragraph: FOURTH DAY--MORNING SESSION. DEBATE CONTINUED-THREE DAYS' ACTION RESCINDED The Board, at 91/2 o'clock yesterday morning, commenced their accustomed exercises with prayer. Rev. Mr. HOTCHKISS moved a reconsideration of the whole subject relating to question No. 2, which was on Thursday evening referred to a Committee of nine then appointed-as he felt convinced that the only means of I settling the point at issue was by a vote of Yea and Nay.

headline.main: THE POOLE MURDER.; Fitting Out the "Grape-Shot." Interview Between the Mayor, City Judge, and George Law. DESCRIPTION OF THE BRIG ISABELLA JEWETT, Police Officer Linn Bailed Out.

docs.lead_paragraph: Excitement is still prevailing in regard to the escape of LOUIS BAKER, who assassinated W M POOLE three weeks ago. It having been ascertained beyond all question that the fugitive is still on board of the Isabella Jewett, the authorities have concluded arrangements With Mr. GEORGE LAW to send forward his elegant new clipper Grapeshot, with a good crew, and an efficient posse of the City Police, to pursue the offender.
